properties.areaDesc: Fulton, GA; Floyd, GA; Gordon, GA; DeKalb, GA; Gwinnett, GA; Pickens, GA; Polk, GA; Forsyth, GA; Cobb, GA; Douglas, GA; Carroll, GA; Cherokee, GA; Bartow, GA; Paulding, GA; Haralson, GA
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 6 at 8:02AM EST until February 6 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Paulding County in northwestern Georgia...
DeKalb County in north central Georgia...
Carroll County in northwestern Georgia...
Douglas County in north central Georgia...
Gwinnett County in north central Georgia...
Floyd County in northwestern Georgia...
Southeastern Gordon County in northwestern Georgia...
Cherokee County in north central Georgia...
Western Forsyth County in north central Georgia...
Haralson County in northwestern Georgia...
Cobb County in north central Georgia...
Fulton County in north central Georgia...
Polk County in northwestern Georgia...
Pickens County in north central Georgia...
Bartow County in northwestern Georgia...

* Until 200 PM EST Thursday.

* At 759 AM EST, law enforcement and Emergency Management in several
districts have reported flash flooding and road closures across
the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen.
Flash flooding is already occurring. Radar also indicates another
round of torrential rainfall moving into the area. Please use
extreme caution when driving!

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Law enforcement.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Atlanta, Marietta, Rome, Douglasville, Lawrenceville, Carrollton,
Canton, Cartersville, Decatur, Calhoun, Dallas, Cedartown, Cumming,
Jasper, Buchanan, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta
and Smyrna.

Additional rainfall amounts of one to three are possible in the
warned area.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you
can do so safely.

A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring.
If you are in the warned area move to higher ground immediately.
Residents living along streams and creeks should take immediate
precautions to protect life and property.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 2:00 PM EST. Avoid flooded areas.
